title: Who is the most easiest to carry champ?
body:
**I've tried using master yi/wukong/olaf always get fed, sometimes carry but I just can't win everygame with them.
Im bronze 5 staying at 70-90 LP for 2 weeks almost now and I want to know an easy carry champ that can just anhilate enemy team when fed. I'm thinking volibear or rengar right nao but no too sure.**

replies.body: Have you tried actually getting better at this game instead of thinking some magic champ will carry you out of the hell you dug yourself into?

while you make a good point, the belittling sarcasm is unnecessary...

> Have you tried looking up guides to improve your game sense? Sometimes, especially in bronze, its less about the champion and more about the decisions you make. If you are consistently getting fed as those champs, keep playing them, and find a guide to help you make better decisions while you are fed.

fixed

> [{quoted}](name=HEAljvLykd,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mWABzWbL,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-26T22:38:46.765+0000)
>
> Have you tried actually getting better at this game instead of thinking some magic champ will carry you out of the hell you dug yourself into?

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

In Bronze you just need to pick a champion, and play them almost every game.  Doesn't matter who.  I scaled out of bronze with Nasus, and carried lots of games.  Stick with one champion and learn how to play against the match ups with that champion.

If anyone tries to tell you it DOES matter who you pick, don't listen to them.  I have a friend that scaled with only Urgot from B5 to S4.

> [{quoted}](name=Zelgoth0002,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mWABzWbL,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-04-26T22:40:57.553+0000)
>
> In Bronze you just need to pick a champion, and play them almost every game.  Doesn't matter who.  I scaled out of bronze with Nasus, and carried lots of games.  Stick with one champion and learn how to play against the match ups with that champion.
> 
> If anyone tries to tell you it DOES matter who you pick, don't listen to them.  I have a friend that scaled with only Urgot from B5 to S4.

That's called luck. I'm sorry I'm trying to start an argument with ya but that's just pure stupid luck. Besides if you played Nasus all the time you really did just get lucky. If you were playing Top or Mid a counter pick for Nasus should have turned up eventually. You're just really lucky and I want some of that luck so hand some over. There is no way that you can climb out of Bronze with one champ unless you're playing with a team that chooses the same champs that fit into a really awesome team comp that allows you all to win if you're working together otherwise no I don't believe it.

Counter picked are not a real thing.  You can beat everyone in lane, some match ups are harder yes, but you can always out play them.  Nasus out scales all of his "counter picks".  Even Graves if you don't feed him.

Plus, the other teams are just as bad/unlucky.  You need to keep that in mind.  They are bronze too.  If you know your champion well enough to win 51% of games, you will scale out.

Find a champion you like and learn them inside out. spam them over and over again. Check my match history, Shen, Shen everywhere. Counter picking only really works in LCS, in low elo ranked its more about what your comfortable playing.

Try studying one champion and learn all the tricks to it 

There are guides all over the net to help you
